catalog_info.title: Health Economics
catalog_info.notes: A graduate level microeconomics class at the level of Economics 2010 or 2020 is required for enrollment. Students unsure about the adequacy of their background should contact the instructor.
catalog_info.description: This course surveys topics in health economics. It touches on public sector issues, the industrial organization of health care markets, interactions between health and labor markets, and health in developing countries. Theory and empirical work are presented.
